summary:
In 2008 I graduated from HAN University of Applied Sciences in Arnhem, The Netherlands, with a Bachelor's degree in Architectural and Structural Engineering. After graduation I worked for (international) architectural firms on projects all over the world and have more than 15 years of professional experience in civil engineering. 

During my career I have been involved in several complex international projects, such as the Fehmarnbelt Fixed Link in Denmark-Germany (DK), Blankenburg Connection (Holland Tunnel) (NL), Qatar Integrated Railway Project: Gold Line Metro Project in Doha (QAT), the Cargo Transportation Route (CaTRo) Project in the Caspian Sea (KZ) and the rehabilitation and beautification of Boyukshor Lake in Baku (AZ). 

Over the years I have developed into a Project Manager, Project Coordinator and all-round Project Management Consultant, capable of overseeing different disciplines, combining these different inputs into integral design solutions, managing projects and processes and delivering project deliverables on time.

I am currently involved in the development of offshore wind projects worldwide for Van Oord as Project Engineer.

Specialties
Project Management, Project Coordination, Project Organisation, Interface Management, Offshore, Offshore Wind, Offshore Construction, Building Information Modeling (BIM), Digital Construction, Civil Engineering, Immersed Tunnels, Cut & Cover Tunnels, Bored Tunnels, Infrastructure, Architecture, Building Engineering, 3D Concrete Printing (3DCP)

Other skills
Autodesk Revit, Autodesk Navisworks, Autodesk AutoCAD, Autodesk 3DS Max, Autodesk BIM360, ThinkProject DESITE, Rhinoceros, Grasshopper, Bentley ProjectWise, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe InDesign, Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote), Microsoft Project, Microsoft Visio, Microsoft Teams

[{'title': 'Fehmarnbelt Link, Denmark', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'The Fehmarnbelt Link will be built as a 18 kilometre long immersed tunnel between Rødbyhavn on Lolland (Denmark) and Fehmarn (Germany). The immersed tunnel will comprise a four lane motorway and two rail tracks. RAT JV (Ramboll/Arup/TEC) supports Femern A/S with the review of design documentation of the immersed tunnel elements, prepared by the immersed tunnel, portals and ramps contractor Femern Link Contractors (FLC). 

As Project Engineer involved in the BIM reviews of the standard elements (STE) and special (SPE) immersed tunnel elements, fire protection measures and joints between immersed tunnel elements.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Melvin', 'last_name': 'Doornebosch', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Project Engineer Offshore Energy'}]}, {'title': 'Blankenburg connection, Holland Tunnel, the Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'The Blankenburg connection is a large and complex project, fitting a three-lane highway in-between two existing highways. As Project Coordinator responsible for the preparations of deliverables for the execution phase, coordination between project teams, and project organisation.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Melvin', 'last_name': 'Doornebosch', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Project Engineer Offshore Energy'}]}, {'title': 'Rail Baltica Riga International Airport (RIX) railway station, Riga, Latvia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'Rail Baltica is a rail transport infrastructural project, which will connect five EU countries – Poland, Lithuania, Latvia, Estonia and Finland – through seven international railway passengers’ stations. The RIX project consist of elevated dual track passenger lines, dead-end tracks for airport express trains and railway station building for airport passengers.

client: Qatar Railways Company
contractor: ALYSJ JV (Aktor, Larsen & Toubro, Yapi Merkezi, STFA, Al Jaber Engineering)

For the Gold Line project Arcadis will work on behalf of the contractor, ALYSJ JV, a joint venture of several international and local construction and engineering firms. The client for the project is the Qatar Rail Company.

The Gold Line (Historic Line) is one of four lines under development in the first phase of Doha's 354 km metro network and is by far the largest single construction package on the Doha Metro, crossing Doha from east to west (Doha Airport South to Al Rayyan). The project includes 16 km of twin bored tunnels along with 13 new underground stations as well as services buildings, tunnels and entrances, in addition to landscaping, traffic and utilities works. The construction phase will utilise six tunnel boring machines simultaneously.

The project covers the detailed design and coordination of architectural finishes for 10 of the 13 new underground stations as well as associated mechanical, electrical, plumbing (MEP), structural and landscape design, plus construction support and consultancy services. 
The remaining three stations on the Gold Line are not yet assigned.

As Design Manager of (underground) Ras Bu Abboud Station and Design Manager Entrances of 10 underground stations responsible for the preparation and development of Detailed Design of architectural finishes, following specific Building Information Modelling (BIM) requirements; coordination of design with Client/Contractor, Lead Designers, third parties and internal disciplines.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Melvin', 'last_name': 'Doornebosch', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Project Engineer Offshore Energy'}]}, {'title': 'Kigali Logistics Platform (KLP), Kigali, Rwanda', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'The Kigali Logistics Platform (KLP) is an inland container and general cargo terminal for bonded and non-bonded cargo in Kigali, Rwanda, under development by DP World. As Project Engineer involved in the preparations of Layout Studies and Concept Design for lay-out of the terminal, construction plans and Technical and Functional Requirements.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Melvin', 'last_name': 'Doornebosch', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Project Engineer Offshore Energy'}]}, {'title': 'Remediation Boyukshor (Phase 1), Baku, Azerbaijan', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'Remediation and beautification of Lake Boyukshor (Phase 1), Baku, Republic of Azerbaijan
client: Tamiz Shahar

client: TengizChevrOil (TCO) / TenizService

The Cargo Transportation Route project is located in the Prorva region, on the north-eastern shores of the Caspian Sea. CaTRo includes a dredged 70-kilometre-long marine access channel, 20-hectare Cargo Offloading Facility (COF) with 1,300-metre-long quay, Cargo Storage Facility (CSF), accommodation camp with Water Treatment Facility (WTF) and 120 km haul road, for the support of transhipment of large units (up to 1800 tons) for TengizChevrOil (TCO) Future Growth Project (FGP) - Wellhead Pressure Management Project (WPMP). 

As Project Engineer involved with and responsible for the preparations of Concept Design, Detailed Design (DD) and Technical Project Documentation (TPD). We enjoy a long and proud tradition of bringing our precision engineering expertise to construct offshore wind farms, preparing the world’s seabeds and ocean floors and to creating new land for a vast array of commercial and public sector projects.

Mission
'As a global marine contractor with over 150 years of experience, we focus on dredging and marine construction, offshore wind, offshore infrastructure, and infrastructure in the Netherlands. Purpose
'Our purpose is to create a better world for future generations by delivering Marine ingenuity.'", 'title': 'Project Engineer Offshore Energy', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 409355, 'name': 'Tunnel Engineering Consultants v.o.f', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C510BAQEzJ_Aslu9Sog/company-logo_400_400/0/1519956530755?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=ycG1Rpm8FzQJiQ3nx_doHr0gyVsYh8QO5Pud00zXBbI', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/tunnel-engineering-consultants-v-o-f/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Copenhagen, Capital Region, Denmark', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}}, 'company': 'Tunnel Engineering Consultants v.o.f', 'description': "The Fehmarnbelt Fixed Link is Denmark's largest infrastructure project and the world's longest immersed tunnel. It will connect Scandinavia and continental Europe with a combined rail (2 tracks) and road connection (four lane motorway) between Denmark and Germany.

At 18 km, from tunnel portal to tunnel portal, it will be the world's longest tunnel of its kind. Its deepest point will be over 40 m. The immersed tunnel is made up of 79 standard elements and 10 special elements with lower levels for equipment and maintenance. One standard element weighs 73,000 tons and is 217 m long, 42 m wide and 10 m high. The Fehmarnbelt Fixed Link is expected to be completed in 2029.

As Ass. Contract Lead Engineer involved in the overall management of the design team.", 'title': 'Ass. Contract Lead Engineer', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Amersfoort, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}}, 'company': 'Tunnel Engineering Consultants v.o.f', 'description': 'Tunnel Engineering Consultants (TEC) is specialised in soft ground tunnelling and a world leading expert in immersed tunnel design, consultancy and project management. 
Since 1988, TEC has delivered solutions to the majority of the world’s most challenging and innovative tunnelling projects.

TEC is a permanent partnership in the field of tunnel and underground works projects between two leading Dutch, internationally operating, engineering consultants Royal HaskoningDHV and Witteveen+Bos. These two companies are experts in their own right and in a much wider field in providing design and consultancy services to enhance society. The establishment of TEC brought together their combined specific knowledge, expertise and experience in soft ground tunnelling, guaranteeing continuity for the successful delivery of every tunnel project.

Although covering the design and engineering of all types of soft ground tunnelling, TEC is famous for their expertise in immersed tunnelling and world leading in this type of tunnelling. 
Since 1988, TEC has delivered design and construction solutions to the majority of the world’s most challenging and innovative tunnelling projects, such as the Øresund Link between Denmark and Sweden, the Busan Geoje Link in South Korea, the 32 km connection between Hong Kong, Zhuhai and Macao in China and the 20 km Fehmarnbelt Link between Denmark and Germany.

Providing expertise at all stages of (immersed) tunnelling projects – from conception and initiation, to design, delivery and operation, we use our integral, innovative and sustainable approach to deliver a multidisciplinary range of consultancy services. These include feasibility studies, design, tender documents and evaluation, design reviews, cost analysis, detailed design and construction supervision.', 'title': 'Project Manager | Project Engineer', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Amersfoort, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'Tunnel Engineering Consultants v.o.f', 'description': 'Blankenburg Link', 'title': 'Project Engineer', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 19254, 'name': 'Witteveen+Bos', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQGbiHnvROshlw/company-logo_400_400/0/1519856596640?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=gqwHp4vqg0JWrsh-e695pr9fzO8IJVpH-5T-zBZzDxg', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/witteveen-bos/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}}, 'company': 'Witteveen+Bos', 'description': 'Witteveen+Bos is an internationally operating Dutch engineering and consultancy firm that provides services in the water, infrastructure, spatial development, environment and construction sectors. We deliver reliable solutions built on the knowledge, local experience, Kazakh design practices, social insight and intellect of our employees.

Our services in Kazakhstan started with consultancy for underwater berms for exploration of the Kashagan Oil field in the North Caspian Sea. Since then our contribution to the Kashagan project expanded, leaving Witteveen+Bos today as the main designing company responsible for the greater part of the marine and civil construction projects involved.

Nowadays the main engineering fields we focus on in Kazakhstan are marine construction, water management and urban development. We can assist our clients from the preliminary concepts up to the supervision of realisation with all stages in between, such as obtaining permits with the relevant RoK authorities ('GOS Approval'). Qatar Integrated Railway Project
The Qatar Integrated Railway Project  is one of the biggest rail projects in the world and will serve as the backbone of the public transport system in the Greater Doha Area. The new network aims to encourage the use of public transportation as a valid and clean alternative to private modes of transport. The network's design bridges the past and future of Qatar.

The Doha Metro is the most prominent and visible project of Qatar Rail and it will serve both the capital and the suburbs with all major locations within easy and convenient reach. Most of the Doha Metro lines will be underground, so tunnelling plays a major role in construction. 

The metro system will be built in two phases: the first will see the construction of three out of the four lines (Red, Gold, and Green) and 37 stations. These lines are expected to be open to the public by 2020. The future phases involve the introduction of an additional line (Blue) and the expansion of the existing ones, with more than 60 additional stations and the first expansion will be completed by 2026.

The Gold Line (Historic Line) is one of four metro lines in the first phase of Doha's 354 km metro network, crossing Doha from east to west. It includes 16 km of twin bored tunnels along with 13 new underground stations, service buildings, tunnels and entrances.", 'title': 'Design Manager | BIM Specialist (secondment)', 'employment_type':
